sparse_graph¶

vizcovidfr.sparse.sparse.sparse_graph(directed=False, show=True)¶

Plot and return the graph of the transfer of patient with Covid-19, inside or outside France.

Note: Try to first plot the undirected graph to see if you can guess the direction of the arrows, then check by calling the function with directed=True !

Parameters

  • directed (bool, optional, default=False)) – whether we want the graph to be directed or not

  • show (bool, optional, default=True) – whether or not to show the graph

Returns

the transfer graph and a plot of its representation

Return type

  • networkx.classes.graph.Graph (if directed=False)

  • networkx.classes.digraph.DiGraph (if directed=True)

Examples

>>> sparse_graph()

>>> sparse_graph(directed=True)

sparse_matrix¶

vizcovidfr.sparse.sparse.sparse_matrix(show=True)¶

Return and plot the adjacency matrix of the graph of the transfer of patient with Covid-19, inside or outside France. This, by definition, is a sparse matrix.

Parameters

show (bool, optional, default=True) – whether or not to show the matrix

Returns

the adjacency matrix of transfer graph and a plot of its representation

Return type

scipy.sparse.csr.csr_matrix

Examples

>>> sparse_matrix(show=True)

>>> from scipy.sparse import isspmatrix
>>> A = sparse_matrix(show=False)
>>> print(isspmatrix(A))
True
